Articles.Content: I think that KSP Lanyards should be sold in the store. Itll be a cool souvenir for ksp players. I'd love to walk around wearing a space-ish lanyard that says "Kerbal Space Program" and has jebediah on it.
Seconded. Though I'm not big on them myself, I'd proudly wear a KSP one!

Any KSP merchandise is interesting. But what will it cost (including shipping)?

For example; I love the maker shop T-shirt ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117780-Coming-Soon-Kerbal-Plushies](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117780-Coming-Soon-Kerbal-Plushies)) and $25.00 is an acceptable price. Until you see what they will charge you for shipping one to The Netherlands: $36.25. That shirt will cost me a total of $61.25. NO WAY I am going to pay that kind of money for ANY T-shirt!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-19T18:18:27Z" title="05/19/2015 06:18  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 19, 2015</time> by Tex\_NL**
  
Typo

Third... ed? You know what I mean. I'm not super-into merchandise for anything but who could deny a Jebediah lanyard? I mean, it's Jeb. I don't think you have to know about KSP to enjoy a smiling face like that.

I was thinking exactly the same thing earlier today. Though for me to want to wear it at work instead of the 'standard issue' I would want something fairly subtle with more emphasis on the logo than a big smiley Jeb every few centimetres. If the price was right I'd go for it.
I'd only buy a lanyard after the Kerbals invent the dang tether...
